content:
TabControl Class

Definition

Manages a related set of tab pages.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultEvent("SelectedIndexChanged")]
[System.ComponentModel.DefaultProperty("TabPages")]
[System.ComponentModel.Designer("System.Windows.Forms.Design.TabControlDesigner, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterface(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType.AutoDispatch)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public class TabControl : System.Windows.Forms.Control

Remarks

A TabControl contains tab pages, which are represented by TabPage objects that you add through the TabPages property. The order of tab pages in this collection reflects the order the tabs appear in the control.

The user can change the current TabPage by clicking one of the tabs in the control. You can also programmatically change the current TabPage by using one of the following TabControl properties:

  • SelectedIndex
  • SelectedTab

    In .NET Framework 2.0, you can also use one of the following methods:

  • SelectTab
  • DeselectTab

    In .NET Framework 2.0, you can respond when the current tab changes by handling one of the following events:

  • Deselecting
  • Deselected
  • Selecting
  • Selected

    The tabs in a TabControl are part of the TabControl, but not parts of the individual TabPage controls. Members of the TabPage class, such as the ForeColor property, affect only the client rectangle of the tab page, but not the tabs. Additionally, the Hide method of the TabPage will not hide the tab. To hide the tab, you must remove the TabPage control from the TabPages collection.

    In .NET Framework 2.0, the tab is considered part of the tab page for determining when the Enter and Leave events of the TabPage occur. In earlier versions of the .NET Framework, the Enter and Leave events of the TabPage do not occur when focus enters or leaves a tab, but only when focus enters or leaves the client rectangle of the tab page.

    The following events are not raised for the TabControl class unless there is at least one TabPage in the TabPages collection: System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click, System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoubleClick, System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseDown, System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseUp, System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseHover, System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseEnter, System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseLeave and System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseMove. If there is at least one TabPage in the collection, and the user interacts with the tab control's header (where the TabPage names appear), the TabControl raises the appropriate event. However, if the user interaction is within the ClientRectangle of the tab page, the TabPage raises the appropriate event.

    Controls contained in a TabPage are not created until the tab page is shown, and any data bindings in these controls are not activated until the tab page is shown.

    When visual styles are enabled, and the Alignment property is set to a value other than TabAlignment, the tab contents might not render correctly. To work around this issue, you can paint the tab contents yourself using owner drawing. For more information, see How to: Display Side-Aligned Tabs with TabControl.

    When the Alignment property is set to a value other than TabAlignment and the Appearance property is set to a value other than TabAppearance, the tab page contents might not render correctly.

Constructors

TabControl()

Initializes a new instance of the TabControl class.

public TabControl ();

Properties

Alignment

Gets or sets the area of the control (for example, along the top) where the tabs are aligned.

public System.Windows.Forms.TabAlignment Alignment { get; set; }
Value
TabAlignment

One of the TabAlignment values. The default is Top.

Exceptions
InvalidEnumArgumentException

The property value is not a valid TabAlignment value.

Remarks

When the Alignment property is set to TabAlignment or TabAlignment, the Multiline property is automatically set to true.

When you set the Appearance property to TabAppearance, it only appears as such when the Alignment property is set to TabAlignment. Otherwise, the Appearance property displays as if set to the TabAppearance value.

When you set the Appearance property to TabAppearance, you must also set the Alignment property to TabAlignment so that the buttons display correctly.

Note

When you set the Appearance property to Buttons, you must also set the Alignment property to Top so that the tab page contents display correctly. Additionally, when visual styles are enabled, and the Alignment property is set to a value other than TabAlignment, the tab contents may not render correctly.

Appearance

Gets or sets the visual appearance of the control's tabs.

public System.Windows.Forms.TabAppearance Appearance { get; set; }
Value
TabAppearance

One of the TabAppearance values. The default is Normal.

Exceptions
InvalidEnumArgumentException

The property value is not a valid TabAppearance value.

Remarks

When you set the Appearance property to FlatButtons, it only appears as such when the Alignment property is set to Top. Otherwise, the Appearance property appears as if set to the Buttons value.

Note

When you set the Appearance property to Buttons, you must also set the Alignment property to Top so that the tab page contents display correctly.

BackColor

This member is not meaningful for this control.

public override System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

The background color for the control.

BackgroundImage

This member is not meaningful for this control.

public override System.Drawing.Image BackgroundImage { get; set; }
Value
Image

The background image displayed in the control.

BackgroundImageLayout

This member is not meaningful for this control.

public override System.Windows.Forms.ImageLayout BackgroundImageLayout { get; set; }
Value
ImageLayout

One of the values of ImageLayout. The default value is Tile.

CreateParams

This member overrides stem.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateParams*.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams CreateParams { get; }
Value
CreateParams

A CreateParams that contains the required creation parameters when the handle to the control is created.

DefaultSize

Gets the default size of the control.

protected override System.Drawing.Size DefaultSize { get; }
Value
Size

The default Size of the control.

DisplayRectangle

Gets the display area of the control's tab pages.

public override System.Drawing.Rectangle DisplayRectangle { get; }
Value
Rectangle

A Rectangle that represents the display area of the tab pages.

DoubleBuffered

This member is not meaningful for this control.

protected override bool DoubleBuffered { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

A Boolean value.

DrawMode

Gets or sets the way that the control's tabs are drawn.

public System.Windows.Forms.TabDrawMode DrawMode { get; set; }
Value
TabDrawMode

One of the TabDrawMode values. The default is Normal.

Exceptions
InvalidEnumArgumentException

The property value is not a valid TabDrawMode value.

Remarks

When you set the DrawMode property to TabDrawMode, the TabControl raises the DrawItem event whenever it needs to paint one of its tabs. To customize the appearance of the tabs, provide your own painting code in a handler for the DrawItem event.

The TabControl does not support variable tab sizes with owner drawing.

ForeColor

This member is not meaningful for this control.

public override System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }
Value
Color

The foreground color of the control.

HotTrack

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control's tabs change in appearance when the mouse passes over them.

public bool HotTrack { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the tabs change in appearance when the mouse passes over them; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The color that the tab changes to when the mouse is over it is determined by the local computer's system colors. To change the system colors, use Control Panel.

ImageList

Gets or sets the images to display on the control's tabs.

public System.Windows.Forms.ImageList ImageList { get; set; }
Value
ImageList

An ImageList that specifies the images to display on the tabs.

Remarks

To display an image on a tab, set the ImageIndex property of that TabPage. The ImageIndex acts as the index into the ImageList.

ItemSize

Gets or sets the size of the control's tabs.

public System.Drawing.Size ItemSize { get; set; }
Value
Size

A Size that represents the size of the tabs. The default automatically sizes the tabs to fit the icons and labels on the tabs.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The width or height of the Size is less than 0.

Remarks

To change the Width property of the ItemSize property, the SizeMode property must be set to Fixed.

Multiline

Gets or sets a value indicating whether more than one row of tabs can be displayed.

public bool Multiline { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if more than one row of tabs can be displayed; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

If Multiline is false, only one row of tabs is displayed, even if all the tabs do not fit in the available space. In that case, however, arrows are displayed that enable the user to navigate to the undisplayed tabs.

If the Multiline property is changed to false while the Alignment property is set to Left or Right, the Alignment property is automatically reset to Top.

Padding

Gets or sets the amount of space around each item on the control's tab pages.

public System.Drawing.Point Padding { get; set; }
Value
Point

A Point that specifies the amount of space around each item. The default is (6,3).

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The width or height of the Point is less than 0.

RightToLeftLayout

Gets or sets a value indicating whether right-to-left mirror placement is turned on.

public virtual bool RightToLeftLayout { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if right-to-left mirror placement is turned on; false for standard child control placement. The default is false.

Remarks

The RightToLeftLayout property is primarily useful for developing forms for worldwide audiences. Many containers are designed so that controls are laid out in the container in a left-to-right fashion. These containers are compatible with languages that follow this writing direction. However, when you display the same containers to users of right-to-left languages, it is often preferable to reverse the order of the controls on the form. If both the RightToLeftLayout and RightToLeft properties are true, mirroring will be turned on for the container and control placement and text flow will be right-to-left.

Changing the value of this property raises the RightToLeftLayoutChanged event.

For more information about globalization issues, see Best Practices for Developing World-Ready Applications.

RowCount

Gets the number of rows that are currently being displayed in the control's tab strip.

public int RowCount { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of rows that are currently being displayed in the tab strip.

Remarks

Use the RowCount property when the Multiline property is true and you want to know the number of rows that the tabs occupy.

SelectedIndex

Gets or sets the index of the currently selected tab page.

public int SelectedIndex { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The zero-based index of the currently selected tab page. The default is -1, which is also the value if no tab page is selected.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The value is less than -1.

SelectedTab

Gets or sets the currently selected tab page.

public System.Windows.Forms.TabPage SelectedTab { get; set; }
Value
TabPage

A TabPage that represents the selected tab page. If no tab page is selected, the value is null.

Remarks

The tab page must be in the TabPages collection to make it the current tab page.

ShowToolTips

Gets or sets a value indicating whether a tab's ToolTip is shown when the mouse passes over the tab.

public bool ShowToolTips { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if ToolTips are shown for the tabs that have them; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

To create a ToolTip for a tab, set the ToolTipText property of the TabPage.

SizeMode

Gets or sets the way that the control's tabs are sized.

public System.Windows.Forms.TabSizeMode SizeMode { get; set; }
Value
TabSizeMode

One of the TabSizeMode values. The default is Normal.

Exceptions
InvalidEnumArgumentException

The property value is not a valid TabSizeMode value.

TabCount

Gets the number of tabs in the tab strip.

public int TabCount { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of tabs in the tab strip.

TabPages

Gets the collection of tab pages in this tab control.

public System.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabPageCollection TabPages { get; }
Value

A TabControl.TabPageCollection that contains the TabPage objects in this TabControl.

Remarks

The order of tab pages in this collection reflects the order the tabs appear in the control.

Text

This member is not meaningful for this control.

public override string Text { get; set; }
Value
String

The text associated with this control.

Methods

CreateControlsInstance()

This member overrides stem.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateControlsInstance*.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection CreateControlsInstance ();
Returns

A new instance of Control.ControlCollection assigned to the control.

CreateHandle()

This member overrides stem.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateHandle*.

protected override void CreateHandle ();

DeselectTab(Int32)

Makes the tab following the tab with the specified index the current tab.

public void DeselectTab (int index);
index
Int32

The index in the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabPages* collection of the tab to deselect.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than 0 or greater than the number of TabPage controls in the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabPages* collection minus 1.

Remarks

Use this method to programmatically deselect a particular tab in a TabControl. If there are at least two tabs in the control, the tab following the specified tab becomes the current tab. If the specified tab is the last tab in the control, the first tab becomes the current tab.

DeselectTab(String)

Makes the tab following the tab with the specified name the current tab.

public void DeselectTab (string tabPageName);
tabPageName
String

The stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Name* of the tab to deselect.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

tabPageName is null.

-or-

tabPageName does not match the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Name* property of any TabPage in the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabPages* collection.

Remarks

Use this method to programmatically deselect a particular tab in a TabControl. If there are at least two tabs in the control, the tab following the specified tab becomes the current tab. If the specified tab is the last tab in the control, the first tab becomes the current tab.

DeselectTab(TabPage)

Makes the tab following the specified TabPage the current tab.

public void DeselectTab (System.Windows.Forms.TabPage tabPage);
tabPage
TabPage

The TabPage to deselect.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than 0 or greater than the number of TabPage controls in the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabPages* collection minus 1.

-or-

tabPage is not in the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabPages* collection.

ArgumentNullException

tabPage is null.

Remarks

Use this method to programmatically deselect a particular tab in a TabControl. If there are at least two tabs in the control, the tab following the specified tab becomes the current tab. If the specified tab is the last tab in the control, the first tab becomes the current tab.

Releases the unmanaged resources used by the Control and its child controls and optionally releases the managed resources.

disposing
Boolean

true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

Int32

Returns

The TabPage at the specified location.

Exceptions

index is less than 0 or greater than the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabCount*.

GetItems()

Gets an array of TabPage controls that belong to the TabControl control.

protected virtual object[] GetItems ();
Returns
Object[]

An array of TabPage controls that belong to the TabControl.

GetItems(Type)

Copies the TabPage controls in the TabControl to an array of the specified type.

protected virtual object[] GetItems (Type baseType);
baseType
Type

The Type of the array to create.

Returns
Object[]

The TabPage controls that belong to the TabControl as an array of the specified type.

Exceptions
ArrayTypeMismatchException

The type TabPage cannot be converted to baseType.

GetTabRect(Int32)

Returns the bounding rectangle for a specified tab in this tab control.

public System.Drawing.Rectangle GetTabRect (int index);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the tab you want.

Returns
Rectangle

A Rectangle that represents the bounds of the specified tab.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index is less than zero.

-or-

The index is greater than or equal to stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabPageCollection.Count*.

GetToolTipText(Object)

Gets the ToolTip for the specified TabPage.

protected string GetToolTipText (object item);
item
Object

The TabPage that owns the desired ToolTip.

Returns
String

The ToolTip text.

IsInputKey(Keys)

Determines whether the specified key is a regular input key or a special key that requires preprocessing.

protected override bool IsInputKey (System.Windows.Forms.Keys keyData);
keyData
Keys

One of the Keys values.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified key is a regular input key; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Call this method during window-message preprocessing to determine whether the specified key is a regular input key that should be sent directly to the tab control or a special key (such as PAGE UP and PAGE DOWN) that should preprocessed. In the latter case, send the key to the control only if it is not consumed by the preprocessing phase.

OnDeselected(TabControlEventArgs)

Raises the Deselected event.

protected virtual void OnDeselected (System.Windows.Forms.TabControlEventArgs e);
e
TabControlEventArgs

A TabControlEventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Handling and Raising Events.

The OnDeselected method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnDeselecting(TabControlCancelEventArgs)

Raises the Deselecting event.

protected virtual void OnDeselecting (System.Windows.Forms.TabControlCancelEventArgs e);
e
TabControlCancelEventArgs

A TabControlCancelEventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Handling and Raising Events.

The OnDeselecting method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnDrawItem(DrawItemEventArgs)

Raises the DrawItem event.

protected virtual void OnDrawItem (System.Windows.Forms.DrawItemEventArgs e);
e
DrawItemEventArgs

A DrawItemEventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Handling and Raising Events.

The OnDrawItem method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnEnter(EventArgs)

Raises the Enter event of the TabControl.

protected override void OnEnter (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

In .NET Framework 2.0, this method also raises the Enter event of the current TabPage. In .NET Framework 2.0, the tab is considered part of the tab page for determining when the Enter and Leave events of the TabPage occur. In earlier versions of the .NET Framework, the Enter and Leave events of the TabPage do not occur when focus enters or leaves a tab, but only when focus enters or leaves the client rectangle of the tab page.

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Handling and Raising Events.

The OnEnter method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnFontChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the FontChanged event.

protected override void OnFontChanged (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Handling and Raising Events.

The OnFontChanged method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnHandleCreated(EventArgs)

This member overrides stem.Windows.Forms.Control.OnHandleCreated*.

protected override void OnHandleCreated (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Raises the HandleDestroyed event.

protected override void OnHandleDestroyed (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Handling and Raising Events.

The OnHandleDestroyed method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnKeyDown(KeyEventArgs)

Raises the KeyDown event.

protected override void OnKeyDown (System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs ke);
ke
KeyEventArgs

A KeyEventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

The TabControl control enables the user to use the keyboard to switch between TabPage controls. The following table describes how the TabControl switches between the selected TabPage controls, depending on which keys are pressed.

Key Description
Keys + Keys Selects the next TabPage.
Keys + Keys + Keys Selects the previous TabPage.
Keys + Keys Selects the next TabPage.
Keys + Keys Selects the previous TabPage.

OnLeave(EventArgs)

Raises the Leave event of the TabControl.

protected override void OnLeave (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

In .NET Framework 2.0, this method also raises the Leave event of the current TabPage. In .NET Framework 2.0, the tab is considered part of the tab page for determining when the Enter and Leave events of the TabPage occur. In earlier versions of the .NET Framework, the Enter and Leave events of the TabPage do not occur when focus enters or leaves a tab, but only when focus enters or leaves the client rectangle of the tab page.

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Handling and Raising Events.

The OnLeave method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

OnResize(EventArgs)

This member overrides stem.Windows.Forms.Control.OnResize*.

e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Removes all the tab pages and additional controls from this tab control.

Remarks

SelectTab(Int32)

Makes the tab with the specified index the current tab.

public void SelectTab (int index);
index
Int32

The index in the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabPages* collection of the tab to select.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than 0 or greater than the number of TabPage controls in the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabPages* collection minus 1.

Remarks

Use this method to programmatically select a particular tab in a TabControl.

SelectTab(String)

Makes the tab with the specified name the current tab.

public void SelectTab (string tabPageName);
tabPageName
String

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

tabPageName is null.

-or-

tabPageName does not match the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Name* property of any TabPage in the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabPages* collection.

Remarks

Use this method to programmatically select a particular tab in a TabControl.

tabPage
TabPage

Exceptions

index is less than 0 or greater than the number of TabPage controls in the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabPages* collection minus 1.

-or-

ArgumentNullException

Remarks

ToString()

Returns a string that represents the TabControl control.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A string that represents the current TabControl.

Remarks

The string includes the type and the Count property of the control. If there is at least one TabPage control on the TabControl, this method returns a string that includes the string returned by the ToString method for the first TabPage.

UpdateTabSelection(Boolean)

Sets the stem.Windows.Forms.TabPage.Visible* property to true for the appropriate TabPage control in the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.TabPages* collection.

protected void UpdateTabSelection (bool updateFocus);
updateFocus
Boolean

true to change focus to the next TabPage; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This method ensures the appropriate TabPage is visible. If you want the tab control to set the Visible property to true for the next TabPage in the tab order, call this method with updateFocus set to true.

Events

BackColorChanged

This event is not meaningful for this control.

public event EventHandler BackColorChanged;

BackgroundImageChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.BackgroundImage* property changes.

public event EventHandler BackgroundImageChanged;

Remarks

The BackgroundImage property is not meaningful for this control, although you can change its value and handle the BackgroundImageChanged event to detect the change.

BackgroundImageLayoutChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.BackgroundImageLayout* property changes.

public event EventHandler BackgroundImageLayoutChanged;

Remarks

The BackgroundImageLayout property is not meaningful for this control, although you can change its value and handle the BackgroundImageLayoutChanged event to detect the change.

Deselected

Occurs when a tab is deselected.

public event System.Windows.Forms.TabControlEventHandler Deselected;

Remarks

When the current tab changes in a TabControl, the following events occur in the following order.

  • Deselecting

  • Deselected

  • Selecting
  • Selected

    These events let you perform tasks such as canceling a tab change if a TabPage is in an invalid state or updating the state of a newly displayed TabPage.

    The current tab changes when the user clicks a tab, when you call the DeselectTab or SelectTab method, or when you change the value of the SelectedIndex or SelectedTab property.

Deselecting

Occurs before a tab is deselected, enabling a handler to cancel the tab change.

public event System.Windows.Forms.TabControlCancelEventHandler Deselecting;

Remarks

When the current tab changes in a TabControl, the following events occur in the following order.

  • Deselecting

  • Deselected
  • Selecting
  • Selected

    These events let you perform tasks such as canceling a tab change if a TabPage is in an invalid state or updating the state of a newly displayed TabPage.

    The current tab changes when the user clicks a tab, when you call the DeselectTab or SelectTab method, or when you change the value of the SelectedIndex or SelectedTab property.

DrawItem

Occurs when the TabControl needs to paint each of its tabs if the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.DrawMode* property is set to TabDrawMode.

public event System.Windows.Forms.DrawItemEventHandler DrawItem;

Remarks

When you set the DrawMode property to TabDrawMode, the TabControl raises the DrawItem event whenever it needs to paint one of its tabs. To customize the appearance of the tabs, provide your own painting code in a handler for the DrawItem event.

The TabControl does not support variable tab sizes with owner drawing.

For more information about handling events, see Handling and Raising Events.

ForeColorChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.ForeColor* property changes.

public event EventHandler ForeColorChanged;

Remarks

The ForeColor property is not meaningful for this control, although you can change its value and handle the ForeColorChanged event to detect the change.

Paint

This event is not meaningful for this control.

public event System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventHandler Paint;

RightToLeftLayoutChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.RightToLeftLayout* property changes.

public event EventHandler RightToLeftLayoutChanged;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see Handling and Raising Events.

Selected

Occurs when a tab is selected.

public event System.Windows.Forms.TabControlEventHandler Selected;

Remarks

When the current tab changes in a TabControl, the following events occur in the following order.

  • Deselecting
  • Deselected
  • Selecting

  • Selected

    These events let you perform tasks such as canceling a tab change if a TabPage is in an invalid state or updating the state of a newly displayed TabPage.

    The current tab changes when the user clicks a tab, when you call the DeselectTab or SelectTab method, or when you change the value of the SelectedIndex or SelectedTab property.

SelectedIndexChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.SelectedIndex* property has changed.

public event EventHandler SelectedIndexChanged;

Remarks

When this event occurs, you can check the SelectedIndex property to determine its new value. Alternatively, you can handle the Selected event and use the TabPageIndex property to determine the index of the selected tab page.

For more information about handling events, see Handling and Raising Events.

Selecting

Occurs before a tab is selected, enabling a handler to cancel the tab change.

public event System.Windows.Forms.TabControlCancelEventHandler Selecting;

Remarks

When the current tab changes in a TabControl, the following events occur in the following order.

  • Deselecting
  • Deselected

  • Selecting

  • Selected

    These events let you perform tasks such as canceling a tab change if a TabPage is in an invalid state or updating the state of a newly displayed TabPage.

    The current tab changes when the user clicks a tab, when you call the DeselectTab or SelectTab method, or when you change the value of the SelectedIndex or SelectedTab property.

TextChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.TabControl.Text* property changes.

public event EventHandler TextChanged;

Remarks

The Text property is not meaningful for this control, although you can change its value and handle the TextChanged event to detect the change.
